verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:1
verses.text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:2
verses.text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:3
verses.text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech, Noah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:4
verses.text: The sons of Noah: Shem, Ham and Japheth. The Japhethites

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:5
verses.text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech and Tiras.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:6
verses.text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:7
verses.text: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittim and the Rodanim. The Hamites

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:8
verses.text: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put and Canaan.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:9
verses.text: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:10
verses.text: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who grew to be a mighty warrior on earth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:11
verses.text: Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:12
verses.text: Pathrusites, Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came) and Caphtorites.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:13
verses.text: Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:14
verses.text: Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:15
verses.text: Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:16
verses.text: Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites. The Semites

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:17
verses.text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram. The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshech.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:18
verses.text: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah the father of Eber.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:19
verses.text: Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his time the earth was divided; his brother was named Joktan.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:20
verses.text: Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:21
verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:22
verses.text: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:23
verses.text: Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:24
verses.text: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:25
verses.text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:26
verses.text: Serug, Nahor, Terah

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:27
verses.text: and Abram (that is, Abraham).

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:28
verses.text: The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael. Descendants of Hagar

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:29
verses.text: These were their descendants: Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:30
verses.text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:31
verses.text: Jetur, Naphish and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael. Descendants of Keturah

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:32
verses.text: The sons born to Keturah, Abraham's concubine: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:33
verses.text: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah. Descendants of Sarah

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:34
verses.text: Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:35
verses.text: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:36
verses.text: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam and Kenaz; by Timna: Amalek.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:37
verses.text: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah. The People of Seir in Edom

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:38
verses.text: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer and Dishan.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:39
verses.text: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan's sister.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:40
verses.text: The sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:41
verses.text: The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran and Keran.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:42
verses.text: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan and Akan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran. The Rulers of Edom

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:43
verses.text: These were the kings who reigned in Edom before any Israelite king reigned: Bela son of Beor, whose city was named Dinhabah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:44
verses.text: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah succeeded him as king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:45
verses.text: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:46
verses.text: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king. His city was named Avith.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:47
verses.text: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah succeeded him as king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:48
verses.text: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the river succeeded him as king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:49
verses.text: When Shaul died, Baal-Hanan son of Acbor succeeded him as king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:50
verses.text: When Baal-Hanan died, Hadad succeeded him as king. His city was named Pau, and his wife's name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-Zahab.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:51
verses.text: Hadad also died. The chiefs of Edom were: Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:52
verses.text: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:53
verses.text: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 1:54
verses.text: Magdiel and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:1
verses.text: These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:2
verses.text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad and Asher.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:3
verses.text: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan and Shelah. These three were born to him by a Canaanite woman, the daughter of Shua. Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the LORD's sight; so the LORD put him to death.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:4
verses.text: Tamar, Judah's daughter-in-law, bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:5
verses.text: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:6
verses.text: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol and Darda -five in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:7
verses.text: The son of Carmi: Achar, who brought trouble on Israel by violating the ban on taking devoted things.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:8
verses.text: The son of Ethan: Azariah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:9
verses.text: The sons born to Hezron were: Jerahmeel, Ram and Caleb. From Ram Son of Hezron

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:10
verses.text: Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab the father of Nahshon, the leader of the people of Judah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:11
verses.text: Nahshon was the father of Salmon, Salmon the father of Boaz,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:12
verses.text: Boaz the father of Obed and Obed the father of Jesse.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:13
verses.text: Jesse was the father of Eliab his firstborn; the second son was Abinadab, the third Shimea,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:14
verses.text: the fourth Nethanel, the fifth Raddai,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:15
verses.text: the sixth Ozem and the seventh David.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:16
verses.text: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah's three sons were Abishai, Joab and Asahel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:17
verses.text: Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite. Caleb Son of Hezron

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:18
verses.text: Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah (and by Jerioth). These were her sons: Jesher, Shobab and Ardon.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:19
verses.text: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:20
verses.text: Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri the father of Bezalel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:21
verses.text: Later, Hezron lay with the daughter of Makir the father of Gilead (he had married her when he was sixty years old), and she bore him Segub.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:22
verses.text: Segub was the father of Jair, who controlled twenty-three towns in Gilead.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:23
verses.text: (But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth Jair, as well as Kenath with its surrounding settlements-sixty towns.) All these were descendants of Makir the father of Gilead.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:24
verses.text: After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Abijah the wife of Hezron bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa. Jerahmeel Son of Hezron

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:25
verses.text: The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron: Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:26
verses.text: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:27
verses.text: The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin and Eker.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:28
verses.text: The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:29
verses.text: Abishur's wife was named Abihail, who bore him Ahban and Molid.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:30
verses.text: The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:31
verses.text: The son of Appaim: Ishi, who was the father of Sheshan. Sheshan was the father of Ahlai.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:32
verses.text: The sons of Jada, Shammai's brother: Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:33
verses.text: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:34
verses.text: Sheshan had no sons-only daughters. He had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:35
verses.text: Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore him Attai.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:36
verses.text: Attai was the father of Nathan, Nathan the father of Zabad,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:37
verses.text: Zabad the father of Ephlal, Ephlal the father of Obed,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:38
verses.text: Obed the father of Jehu, Jehu the father of Azariah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:39
verses.text: Azariah the father of Helez, Helez the father of Eleasah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:40
verses.text: Eleasah the father of Sismai, Sismai the father of Shallum,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:41
verses.text: Shallum the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah the father of Elishama. The Clans of Caleb

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:42
verses.text: The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and his son Mareshah, who was the father of Hebron.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:43
verses.text: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem and Shema.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:44
verses.text: Shema was the father of Raham, and Raham the father of Jorkeam. Rekem was the father of Shammai.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:45
verses.text: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:46
verses.text: Caleb's concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:47
verses.text: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah and Shaaph.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:48
verses.text: Caleb's concubine Maacah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:49
verses.text: She also gave birth to Shaaph the father of Madmannah and to Sheva the father of Macbenah and Gibea. Caleb's daughter was Acsah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:50
verses.text: These were the descendants of Caleb. The sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:51
verses.text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:52
verses.text: The descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim were: Haroeh, half the Manahathites,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:53
verses.text: and the clans of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites and Mishraites. From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:54
verses.text: The descendants of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 2:55
verses.text: and the clans of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Recab.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:1
verses.text: These were the sons of David born to him in Hebron: The firstborn was Amnon the son of Ahinoam of Jezreel; the second, Daniel the son of Abigail of Carmel;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:2
verses.text: the third, Absalom the son of Maacah daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:3
verses.text: the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital; and the sixth, Ithream, by his wife Eglah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:4
verses.text: These six were born to David in Hebron, where he reigned seven years and six months. David reigned in Jerusalem thirty-three years,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:5
verses.text: and these were the children born to him there: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan and Solomon. These four were by Bathsheba daughter of Ammiel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:6
verses.text: There were also Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:7
verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:8
verses.text: Elishama, Eliada and Eliphelet-nine in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:9
verses.text: All these were the sons of David, besides his sons by his concubines. And Tamar was their sister. The Kings of Judah

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:10
verses.text: Solomon's son was Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:11
verses.text: Jehoram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:12
verses.text: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:13
verses.text: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:14
verses.text: Amon his son, Josiah his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:15
verses.text: The sons of Josiah: Johanan the firstborn, Jehoiakim the second son, Zedekiah the third, Shallum the fourth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:16
verses.text: The successors of Jehoiakim: Jehoiachin his son, and Zedekiah. The Royal Line After the Exile

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:17
verses.text: The descendants of Jehoiachin the captive: Shealtiel his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:18
verses.text: Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama and Nedabiah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:19
verses.text: The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah. Shelomith was their sister.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:20
verses.text: There were also five others: Hashubah, Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah and Jushab-Hesed.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:21
verses.text: The descendants of Hananiah: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, and the sons of Rephaiah, of Arnan, of Obadiah and of Shecaniah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:22
verses.text: The descendants of Shecaniah: Shemaiah and his sons: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah and Shaphat-six in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:23
verses.text: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, Hizkiah and Azrikam-three in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 3:24
verses.text: The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani-seven in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:1
verses.text: The descendants of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur and Shobal.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:2
verses.text: Reaiah son of Shobal was the father of Jahath, and Jahath the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:3
verses.text: These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma and Idbash. Their sister was named Hazzelelponi.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:4
verses.text: Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These were the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and father of Bethlehem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:5
verses.text: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:6
verses.text: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari. These were the descendants of Naarah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:7
verses.text: The sons of Helah: Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:8
verses.text: and Koz, who was the father of Anub and Hazzobebah and of the clans of Aharhel son of Harum.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:9
verses.text: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. His mother had named him Jabez, saying, "I gave birth to him in pain."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:10
verses.text: Jabez cried out to the God of Israel, "Oh, that you would bless me and enlarge my territory! Let your hand be with me, and keep me from harm so that I will be free from pain." And God granted his request.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:11
verses.text: Kelub, Shuhah's brother, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:12
verses.text: Eshton was the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These were the men of Recah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:13
verses.text: The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel: Hathath and Meonothai.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:14
verses.text: Meonothai was the father of Ophrah. Seraiah was the father of Joab, the father of Ge Harashim. It was called this because its people were craftsmen.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:15
verses.text: The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah and Naam. The son of Elah: Kenaz.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:16
verses.text: The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:17
verses.text: The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher and Jalon. One of Mered's wives gave birth to Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:18
verses.text: (His Judean wife gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) These were the children of Pharaoh's daughter Bithiah, whom Mered had married.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:19
verses.text: The sons of Hodiah's wife, the sister of Naham: the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:20
verses.text: The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan and Tilon. The descendants of Ishi: Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:21
verses.text: The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah and the clans of the linen workers at Beth Ashbea,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:22
verses.text: Jokim, the men of Cozeba, and Joash and Saraph, who ruled in Moab and Jashubi Lehem. (These records are from ancient times.)

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:23
verses.text: They were the potters who lived at Netaim and Gederah; they stayed there and worked for the king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:24
verses.text: The descendants of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah and Shaul;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:25
verses.text: Shallum was Shaul's son, Mibsam his son and Mishma his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:26
verses.text: The descendants of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son and Shimei his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:27
verses.text: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children; so their entire clan did not become as numerous as the people of Judah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:28
verses.text: They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:29
verses.text: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:30
verses.text: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:31
verses.text: Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri and Shaaraim. These were their towns until the reign of David.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:32
verses.text: Their surrounding villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token and Ashan-five towns-

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:33
verses.text: and all the villages around these towns as far as Baalath. These were their settlements. And they kept a genealogical record.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:34
verses.text: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:35
verses.text: Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:36
verses.text: also Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:37
verses.text: and Ziza son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:38
verses.text: The men listed above by name were leaders of their clans. Their families increased greatly,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:39
verses.text: and they went to the outskirts of Gedor to the east of the valley in search of pasture for their flocks.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:40
verses.text: They found rich, good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful and quiet. Some Hamites had lived there formerly.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:41
verses.text: The men whose names were listed came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. They attacked the Hamites in their dwellings and also the Meunites who were there and completely destroyed them, as is evident to this day. Then they settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:42
verses.text: And five hundred of these Simeonites, led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, invaded the hill country of Seir.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 4:43
verses.text: They killed the remaining Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:1
verses.text: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (he was the firstborn, but when he defiled his father's marriage bed, his rights as firstborn were given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel; so he could not be listed in the genealogical record in accordance with his birthright,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:2
verses.text: and though Judah was the strongest of his brothers and a ruler came from him, the rights of the firstborn belonged to Joseph)-

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:3
verses.text: the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron and Carmi.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:4
verses.text: The descendants of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:5
verses.text: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:6
verses.text: and Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria took into exile. Beerah was a leader of the Reubenites.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:7
verses.text: Their relatives by clans, listed according to their genealogical records: Jeiel the chief, Zechariah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:8
verses.text: and Bela son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel. They settled in the area from Aroer to Nebo and Baal Meon.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:9
verses.text: To the east they occupied the land up to the edge of the desert that extends to the Euphrates River, because their livestock had increased in Gilead.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:10
verses.text: During Saul's reign they waged war against the Hagrites, who were defeated at their hands; they occupied the dwellings of the Hagrites throughout the entire region east of Gilead.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:11
verses.text: The Gadites lived next to them in Bashan, as far as Salecah:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:12
verses.text: Joel was the chief, Shapham the second, then Janai and Shaphat, in Bashan.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:13
verses.text: Their relatives, by families, were: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia and Eber-seven in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:14
verses.text: These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:15
verses.text: Ahi son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their family.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:16
verses.text: The Gadites lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its outlying villages, and on all the pasturelands of Sharon as far as they extended.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:17
verses.text: All these were entered in the genealogical records during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:18
verses.text: The Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 men ready for military service-able-bodied men who could handle shield and sword, who could use a bow, and who were trained for battle.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:19
verses.text: They waged war against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish and Nodab.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:20
verses.text: They were helped in fighting them, and God handed the Hagrites and all their allies over to them, because they cried out to him during the battle. He answered their prayers, because they trusted in him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:21
verses.text: They seized the livestock of the Hagrites-fifty thousand camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep and two thousand donkeys. They also took one hundred thousand people captive,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:22
verses.text: and many others fell slain, because the battle was God's. And they occupied the land until the exile.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:23
verses.text: The people of the half-tribe of Manasseh were numerous; they settled in the land from Bashan to Baal Hermon, that is, to Senir (Mount Hermon).

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:24
verses.text: These were the heads of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah and Jahdiel. They were brave warriors, famous men, and heads of their families.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:25
verses.text: But they were unfaithful to the God of their fathers and prostituted themselves to the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 5:26
verses.text: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria (that is, Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria), who took the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile. He took them to Halah, Habor, Hara and the river of Gozan, where they are to this day.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:1
verses.text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:2
verses.text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:3
verses.text: The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:4
verses.text: Eleazar was the father of Phinehas, Phinehas the father of Abishua,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:5
verses.text: Abishua the father of Bukki, Bukki the father of Uzzi,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:6
verses.text: Uzzi the father of Zerahiah, Zerahiah the father of Meraioth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:7
verses.text: Meraioth the father of Amariah, Amariah the father of Ahitub,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:8
verses.text: Ahitub the father of Zadok, Zadok the father of Ahimaaz,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:9
verses.text: Ahimaaz the father of Azariah, Azariah the father of Johanan,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:10
verses.text: Johanan the father of Azariah (it was he who served as priest in the temple Solomon built in Jerusalem),

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:11
verses.text: Azariah the father of Amariah, Amariah the father of Ahitub,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:12
verses.text: Ahitub the father of Zadok, Zadok the father of Shallum,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:13
verses.text: Shallum the father of Hilkiah, Hilkiah the father of Azariah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:14
verses.text: Azariah the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah the father of Jehozadak.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:15
verses.text: Jehozadak was deported when the LORD sent Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:16
verses.text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:17
verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:18
verses.text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:19
verses.text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites listed according to their fathers:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:20
verses.text: Of Gershon: Libni his son, Jehath his son, Zimmah his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:21
verses.text: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son and Jeatherai his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:22
verses.text: The descendants of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:23
verses.text: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:24
verses.text: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son and Shaul his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:25
verses.text: The descendants of Elkanah: Amasai, Ahimoth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:26
verses.text: Elkanah his son, Zophai his son, Nahath his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:27
verses.text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son and Samuel his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:28
verses.text: The sons of Samuel: Joel the firstborn and Abijah the second son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:29
verses.text: The descendants of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:30
verses.text: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son and Asaiah his son. The Temple Musicians

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:31
verses.text: These are the men David put in charge of the music in the house of the LORD after the ark came to rest there.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:32
verses.text: They ministered with music before the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, until Solomon built the temple of the LORD in Jerusalem. They performed their duties according to the regulations laid down for them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:33
verses.text: Here are the men who served, together with their sons: From the Kohathites: Heman, the musician, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:34
verses.text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:35
verses.text: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:36
verses.text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:37
verses.text: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:38
verses.text: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:39
verses.text: and Heman's associate Asaph, who served at his right hand: Asaph son of Berekiah, the son of Shimea,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:40
verses.text: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malkijah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:41
verses.text: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:42
verses.text: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:43
verses.text: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershon, the son of Levi;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:44
verses.text: and from their associates, the Merarites, at his left hand: Ethan son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:45
verses.text: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:46
verses.text: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:47
verses.text: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:48
verses.text: Their fellow Levites were assigned to all the other duties of the tabernacle, the house of God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:49
verses.text: But Aaron and his descendants were the ones who presented offerings on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense in connection with all that was done in the Most Holy Place, making atonement for Israel, in accordance with all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:50
verses.text: These were the descendants of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:51
verses.text: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:52
verses.text: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:53
verses.text: Zadok his son and Ahimaaz his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:54
verses.text: These were the locations of their settlements allotted as their territory (they were assigned to the descendants of Aaron who were from the Kohathite clan, because the first lot was for them):

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:55
verses.text: They were given Hebron in Judah with its surrounding pasturelands.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:56
verses.text: But the fields and villages around the city were given to Caleb son of Jephunneh.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:57
verses.text: So the descendants of Aaron were given Hebron (a city of refuge), and Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:58
verses.text: Hilen, Debir,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:59
verses.text: Ashan, Juttah and Beth Shemesh, together with their pasturelands.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:60
verses.text: And from the tribe of Benjamin they were given Gibeon, Geba, Alemeth and Anathoth, together with their pasturelands. These towns, which were distributed among the Kohathite clans, were thirteen in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:61
verses.text: The rest of Kohath's descendants were allotted ten towns from the clans of half the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:62
verses.text: The descendants of Gershon, clan by clan, were allotted thirteen towns from the tribes of Issachar, Asher and Naphtali, and from the part of the tribe of Manasseh that is in Bashan.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:63
verses.text: The descendants of Merari, clan by clan, were allotted twelve towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad and Zebulun.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:64
verses.text: So the Israelites gave the Levites these towns and their pasturelands.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:65
verses.text: From the tribes of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin they allotted the previously named towns.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:66
verses.text: Some of the Kohathite clans were given as their territory towns from the tribe of Ephraim.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:67
verses.text: In the hill country of Ephraim they were given Shechem (a city of refuge), and Gezer,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:68
verses.text: Jokmeam, Beth Horon,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:69
verses.text: Aijalon and Gath Rimmon, together with their pasturelands.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:70
verses.text: And from half the tribe of Manasseh the Israelites gave Aner and Bileam, together with their pasturelands, to the rest of the Kohathite clans.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:71
verses.text: The Gershonites received the following: From the clan of the half-tribe of Manasseh they received Golan in Bashan and also Ashtaroth, together with their pasturelands;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:72
verses.text: from the tribe of Issachar they received Kedesh, Daberath,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:73
verses.text: Ramoth and Anem, together with their pasturelands;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:74
verses.text: from the tribe of Asher they received Mashal, Abdon,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:75
verses.text: Hukok and Rehob, together with their pasturelands;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:76
verses.text: and from the tribe of Naphtali they received Kedesh in Galilee, Hammon and Kiriathaim, together with their pasturelands.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:77
verses.text: The Merarites (the rest of the Levites) received the following: From the tribe of Zebulun they received Jokneam, Kartah, Rimmono and Tabor, together with their pasturelands;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:78
verses.text: from the tribe of Reuben across the Jordan east of Jericho they received Bezer in the desert, Jahzah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:79
verses.text: Kedemoth and Mephaath, together with their pasturelands;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:80
verses.text: and from the tribe of Gad they received Ramoth in Gilead, Mahanaim,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 6:81
verses.text: Heshbon and Jazer, together with their pasturelands.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:1
verses.text: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub and Shimron-four in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:2
verses.text: The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam and Samuel-heads of their families. During the reign of David, the descendants of Tola listed as fighting men in their genealogy numbered 22,600.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:3
verses.text: The son of Uzzi: Izrahiah. The sons of Izrahiah: Michael, Obadiah, Joel and Isshiah. All five of them were chiefs.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:4
verses.text: According to their family genealogy, they had 36,000 men ready for battle, for they had many wives and children.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:5
verses.text: The relatives who were fighting men belonging to all the clans of Issachar, as listed in their genealogy, were 87,000 in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:6
verses.text: Three sons of Benjamin: Bela, Beker and Jediael.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:7
verses.text: The sons of Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth and Iri, heads of families-five in all. Their genealogical record listed 22,034 fighting men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:8
verses.text: The sons of Beker: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Beker.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:9
verses.text: Their genealogical record listed the heads of families and 20,200 fighting men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:10
verses.text: The son of Jediael: Bilhan. The sons of Bilhan: Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish and Ahishahar.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:11
verses.text: All these sons of Jediael were heads of families. There were 17,200 fighting men ready to go out to war.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:12
verses.text: The Shuppites and Huppites were the descendants of Ir, and the Hushites the descendants of Aher.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:13
verses.text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer and Shillem -the descendants of Bilhah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:14
verses.text: The descendants of Manasseh: Asriel was his descendant through his Aramean concubine. She gave birth to Makir the father of Gilead.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:15
verses.text: Makir took a wife from among the Huppites and Shuppites. His sister's name was Maacah. Another descendant was named Zelophehad, who had only daughters.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:16
verses.text: Makir's wife Maacah gave birth to a son and named him Peresh. His brother was named Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:17
verses.text: The son of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead son of Makir, the son of Manasseh.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:18
verses.text: His sister Hammoleketh gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer and Mahlah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:19
verses.text: The sons of Shemida were: Ahian, Shechem, Likhi and Aniam.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:20
verses.text: The descendants of Ephraim: Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:21
verses.text: Zabad his son and Shuthelah his son. Ezer and Elead were killed by the native-born men of Gath, when they went down to seize their livestock.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:22
verses.text: Their father Ephraim mourned for them many days, and his relatives came to comfort him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:23
verses.text: Then he lay with his wife again, and she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. He named him Beriah, because there had been misfortune in his family.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:24
verses.text: His daughter was Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth Horon as well as Uzzen Sheerah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:25
verses.text: Rephah was his son, Resheph his son, Telah his son, Tahan his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:26
verses.text: Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:27
verses.text: Nun his son and Joshua his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:28
verses.text: Their lands and settlements included Bethel and its surrounding villages, Naaran to the east, Gezer and its villages to the west, and Shechem and its villages all the way to Ayyah and its villages.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:29
verses.text: Along the borders of Manasseh were Beth Shan, Taanach, Megiddo and Dor, together with their villages. The descendants of Joseph son of Israel lived in these towns.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:30
verses.text: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi and Beriah. Their sister was Serah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:31
verses.text: The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malkiel, who was the father of Birzaith.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:32
verses.text: Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer and Hotham and of their sister Shua.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:33
verses.text: The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, Bimhal and Ashvath. These were Japhlet's sons.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:34
verses.text: The sons of Shomer: Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah and Aram.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:35
verses.text: The sons of his brother Helem: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh and Amal.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:36
verses.text: The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:37
verses.text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran and Beera.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:38
verses.text: The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, Pispah and Ara.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:39
verses.text: The sons of Ulla: Arah, Hanniel and Rizia.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 7:40
verses.text: All these were descendants of Asher-heads of families, choice men, brave warriors and outstanding leaders. The number of men ready for battle, as listed in their genealogy, was 26,000.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:1
verses.text: Benjamin was the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second son, Aharah the third,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:2
verses.text: Nohah the fourth and Rapha the fifth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:3
verses.text: The sons of Bela were: Addar, Gera, Abihud,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:4
verses.text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:5
verses.text: Gera, Shephuphan and Huram.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:6
verses.text: These were the descendants of Ehud, who were heads of families of those living in Geba and were deported to Manahath:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:7
verses.text: Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, who deported them and who was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:8
verses.text: Sons were born to Shaharaim in Moab after he had divorced his wives Hushim and Baara.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:9
verses.text: By his wife Hodesh he had Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:10
verses.text: Jeuz, Sakia and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of families.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:11
verses.text: By Hushim he had Abitub and Elpaal.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:12
verses.text: The sons of Elpaal: Eber, Misham, Shemed (who built Ono and Lod with its surrounding villages),

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:13
verses.text: and Beriah and Shema, who were heads of families of those living in Aijalon and who drove out the inhabitants of Gath.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:14
verses.text: Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:15
verses.text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:16
verses.text: Michael, Ishpah and Joha were the sons of Beriah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:17
verses.text: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:18
verses.text: Ishmerai, Izliah and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:19
verses.text: Jakim, Zicri, Zabdi,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:20
verses.text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:21
verses.text: Adaiah, Beraiah and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:22
verses.text: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:23
verses.text: Abdon, Zicri, Hanan,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:24
verses.text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:25
verses.text: Iphdeiah and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:26
verses.text: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:27
verses.text: Jaareshiah, Elijah and Zicri were the sons of Jeroham.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:28
verses.text: All these were heads of families, chiefs as listed in their genealogy, and they lived in Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:29
verses.text: Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon. His wife's name was Maacah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:30
verses.text: and his firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:31
verses.text: Gedor, Ahio, Zeker

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:32
verses.text: and Mikloth, who was the father of Shimeah. They too lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:33
verses.text: Ner was the father of Kish, Kish the father of Saul, and Saul the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab and Esh-Baal.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:34
verses.text: The son of Jonathan: Merib-Baal, who was the father of Micah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:35
verses.text: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tarea and Ahaz.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:36
verses.text: Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah, Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri, and Zimri was the father of Moza.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:37
verses.text: Moza was the father of Binea; Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son and Azel his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:38
verses.text: Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:39
verses.text: The sons of his brother Eshek: Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second son and Eliphelet the third.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 8:40
verses.text: The sons of Ulam were brave warriors who could handle the bow. They had many sons and grandsons-150 in all. All these were the descendants of Benjamin.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:1
verses.text: All Israel was listed in the genealogies recorded in the book of the kings of Israel. The people of Judah were taken captive to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:2
verses.text: Now the first to resettle on their own property in their own towns were some Israelites, priests, Levites and temple servants.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:3
verses.text: Those from Judah, from Benjamin, and from Ephraim and Manasseh who lived in Jerusalem were:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:4
verses.text: Uthai son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, a descendant of Perez son of Judah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:5
verses.text: Of the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:6
verses.text: Of the Zerahites: Jeuel. The people from Judah numbered 690.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:7
verses.text: Of the Benjamites: Sallu son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:8
verses.text: Ibneiah son of Jeroham; Elah son of Uzzi, the son of Micri; and Meshullam son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:9
verses.text: The people from Benjamin, as listed in their genealogy, numbered 956. All these men were heads of their families.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:10
verses.text: Of the priests: Jedaiah; Jehoiarib; Jakin;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:11
verses.text: Azariah son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the official in charge of the house of God;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:12
verses.text: Adaiah son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malkijah; and Maasai son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:13
verses.text: The priests, who were heads of families, numbered 1,760. They were able men, responsible for ministering in the house of God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:14
verses.text: Of the Levites: Shemaiah son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, a Merarite;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:15
verses.text: Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal and Mattaniah son of Mica, the son of Zicri, the son of Asaph;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:16
verses.text: Obadiah son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berekiah son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:17
verses.text: The gatekeepers: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman and their brothers, Shallum their chief

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:18
verses.text: being stationed at the King's Gate on the east, up to the present time. These were the gatekeepers belonging to the camp of the Levites.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:19
verses.text: Shallum son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his fellow gatekeepers from his family (the Korahites) were responsible for guarding the thresholds of the Tent just as their fathers had been responsible for guarding the entrance to the dwelling of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:20
verses.text: In earlier times Phinehas son of Eleazar was in charge of the gatekeepers, and the LORD was with him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:21
verses.text: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:22
verses.text: Altogether, those chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds numbered 212. They were registered by genealogy in their villages. The gatekeepers had been assigned to their positions of trust by David and Samuel the seer.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:23
verses.text: They and their descendants were in charge of guarding the gates of the house of the LORD -the house called the Tent.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:24
verses.text: The gatekeepers were on the four sides: east, west, north and south.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:25
verses.text: Their brothers in their villages had to come from time to time and share their duties for seven-day periods.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:26
verses.text: But the four principal gatekeepers, who were Levites, were entrusted with the responsibility for the rooms and treasuries in the house of God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:27
verses.text: They would spend the night stationed around the house of God, because they had to guard it; and they had charge of the key for opening it each morning.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:28
verses.text: Some of them were in charge of the articles used in the temple service; they counted them when they were brought in and when they were taken out.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:29
verses.text: Others were assigned to take care of the furnishings and all the other articles of the sanctuary, as well as the flour and wine, and the oil, incense and spices.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:30
verses.text: But some of the priests took care of mixing the spices.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:31
verses.text: A Levite named Mattithiah, the firstborn son of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with the responsibility for baking the offering bread.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:32
verses.text: Some of their Kohathite brothers were in charge of preparing for every Sabbath the bread set out on the table.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:33
verses.text: Those who were musicians, heads of Levite families, stayed in the rooms of the temple and were exempt from other duties because they were responsible for the work day and night.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:34
verses.text: All these were heads of Levite families, chiefs as listed in their genealogy, and they lived in Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:35
verses.text: Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon. His wife's name was Maacah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:36
verses.text: and his firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:37
verses.text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah and Mikloth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:38
verses.text: Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They too lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:39
verses.text: Ner was the father of Kish, Kish the father of Saul, and Saul the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab and Esh-Baal.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:40
verses.text: The son of Jonathan: Merib-Baal, who was the father of Micah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:41
verses.text: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tahrea and Ahaz.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:42
verses.text: Ahaz was the father of Jadah, Jadah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri, and Zimri was the father of Moza.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:43
verses.text: Moza was the father of Binea; Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son and Azel his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 9:44
verses.text: Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:1
verses.text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; the Israelites fled before them, and many fell slain on Mount Gilboa.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:2
verses.text: The Philistines pressed hard after Saul and his sons, and they killed his sons Jonathan, Abinadab and Malki-Shua.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:3
verses.text: The fighting grew fierce around Saul, and when the archers overtook him, they wounded him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:4
verses.text: Saul said to his armor-bearer, "Draw your sword and run me through, or these uncircumcised fellows will come and abuse me." But his armor-bearer was terrified and would not do it; so Saul took his own sword and fell on it.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:5
verses.text: When the armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:6
verses.text: So Saul and his three sons died, and all his house died together.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:7
verses.text: When all the Israelites in the valley saw that the army had fled and that Saul and his sons had died, they abandoned their towns and fled. And the Philistines came and occupied them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:8
verses.text: The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:9
verses.text: They stripped him and took his head and his armor, and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news among their idols and their people.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:10
verses.text: They put his armor in the temple of their gods and hung up his head in the temple of Dagon.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:11
verses.text: When all the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard of everything the Philistines had done to Saul,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:12
verses.text: all their valiant men went and took the bodies of Saul and his sons and brought them to Jabesh. Then they buried their bones under the great tree in Jabesh, and they fasted seven days.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:13
verses.text: Saul died because he was unfaithful to the LORD; he did not keep the word of the LORD and even consulted a medium for guidance,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 10:14
verses.text: and did not inquire of the LORD. So the LORD put him to death and turned the kingdom over to David son of Jesse.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:1
verses.text: All Israel came together to David at Hebron and said, "We are your own flesh and blood.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:2
verses.text: In the past, even while Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel on their military campaigns. And the LORD your God said to you, 'You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will become their ruler.'"

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:3
verses.text: When all the elders of Israel had come to King David at Hebron, he made a compact with them at Hebron before the LORD, and they anointed David king over Israel, as the LORD had promised through Samuel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:4
verses.text: David and all the Israelites marched to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus). The Jebusites who lived there

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:5
verses.text: said to David, "You will not get in here." Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion, the City of David.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:6
verses.text: David had said, "Whoever leads the attack on the Jebusites will become commander-in-chief." Joab son of Zeruiah went up first, and so he received the command.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:7
verses.text: David then took up residence in the fortress, and so it was called the City of David.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:8
verses.text: He built up the city around it, from the supporting terraces to the surrounding wall, while Joab restored the rest of the city.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:9
verses.text: And David became more and more powerful, because the LORD Almighty was with him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:10
verses.text: These were the chiefs of David's mighty men-they, together with all Israel, gave his kingship strong support to extend it over the whole land, as the LORD had promised-

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:11
verses.text: this is the list of David's mighty men: Jashobeam, a Hacmonite, was chief of the officers; he raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed in one encounter.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:12
verses.text: Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodai the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:13
verses.text: He was with David at Pas Dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. At a place where there was a field full of barley, the troops fled from the Philistines.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:14
verses.text: But they took their stand in the middle of the field. They defended it and struck the Philistines down, and the LORD brought about a great victory.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:15
verses.text: Three of the thirty chiefs came down to David to the rock at the cave of Adullam, while a band of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:16
verses.text: At that time David was in the stronghold, and the Philistine garrison was at Bethlehem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:17
verses.text: David longed for water and said, "Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!"

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:18
verses.text: So the Three broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem and carried it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out before the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:19
verses.text: "God forbid that I should do this!" he said. "Should I drink the blood of these men who went at the risk of their lives?" Because they risked their lives to bring it back, David would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:20
verses.text: Abishai the brother of Joab was chief of the Three. He raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed, and so he became as famous as the Three.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:21
verses.text: He was doubly honored above the Three and became their commander, even though he was not included among them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:22
verses.text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a valiant fighter from Kabzeel, who performed great exploits. He struck down two of Moab's best men. He also went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:23
verses.text: And he struck down an Egyptian who was seven and a half feet tall. Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver's rod in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club. He snatched the spear from the Egyptian's hand and killed him with his own spear.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:24
verses.text: Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; he too was as famous as the three mighty men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:25
verses.text: He was held in greater honor than any of the Thirty, but he was not included among the Three. And David put him in charge of his bodyguard.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:26
verses.text: The mighty men were: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:27
verses.text: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:28
verses.text: Ira son of Ikkesh from Tekoa, Abiezer from Anathoth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:29
verses.text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:30
verses.text: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:31
verses.text: Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah in Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:32
verses.text: Hurai from the ravines of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:33
verses.text: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:34
verses.text: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan son of Shagee the Hararite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:35
verses.text: Ahiam son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal son of Ur,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:36
verses.text: Hepher the Mekerathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:37
verses.text: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai son of Ezbai,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:38
verses.text: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar son of Hagri,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:39
verses.text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armor-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:40
verses.text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:41
verses.text: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad son of Ahlai,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:42
verses.text: Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, who was chief of the Reubenites, and the thirty with him,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:43
verses.text: Hanan son of Maacah, Joshaphat the Mithnite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:44
verses.text: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:45
verses.text: Jediael son of Shimri, his brother Joha the Tizite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:46
verses.text: Eliel the Mahavite, Jeribai and Joshaviah the sons of Elnaam, Ithmah the Moabite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 11:47
verses.text: Eliel, Obed and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:1
verses.text: These were the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he was banished from the presence of Saul son of Kish (they were among the warriors who helped him in battle;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:2
verses.text: they were armed with bows and were able to shoot arrows or to sling stones right-handed or left-handed; they were kinsmen of Saul from the tribe of Benjamin):

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:3
verses.text: Ahiezer their chief and Joash the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet the sons of Azmaveth; Beracah, Jehu the Anathothite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:4
verses.text: and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the Thirty, who was a leader of the Thirty; Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:5
verses.text: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah and Shephatiah the Haruphite;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:6
verses.text: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer and Jashobeam the Korahites;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:7
verses.text: and Joelah and Zebadiah the sons of Jeroham from Gedor.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:8
verses.text: Some Gadites defected to David at his stronghold in the desert. They were brave warriors, ready for battle and able to handle the shield and spear. Their faces were the faces of lions, and they were as swift as gazelles in the mountains.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:9
verses.text: Ezer was the chief, Obadiah the second in command, Eliab the third,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:10
verses.text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:11
verses.text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:12
verses.text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:13
verses.text: Jeremiah the tenth and Macbannai the eleventh.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:14
verses.text: These Gadites were army commanders; the least was a match for a hundred, and the greatest for a thousand.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:15
verses.text: It was they who crossed the Jordan in the first month when it was overflowing all its banks, and they put to flight everyone living in the valleys, to the east and to the west.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:16
verses.text: Other Benjamites and some men from Judah also came to David in his stronghold.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:17
verses.text: David went out to meet them and said to them, "If you have come to me in peace, to help me, I am ready to have you unite with me. But if you have come to betray me to my enemies when my hands are free from violence, may the God of our fathers see it and judge you."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:18
verses.text: Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, chief of the Thirty, and he said: "We are yours, O David! We are with you, O son of Jesse! Success, success to you, and success to those who help you, for your God will help you." So David received them and made them leaders of his raiding bands.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:19
verses.text: Some of the men of Manasseh defected to David when he went with the Philistines to fight against Saul. (He and his men did not help the Philistines because, after consultation, their rulers sent him away. They said, "It will cost us our heads if he deserts to his master Saul.")

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:20
verses.text: When David went to Ziklag, these were the men of Manasseh who defected to him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu and Zillethai, leaders of units of a thousand in Manasseh.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:21
verses.text: They helped David against raiding bands, for all of them were brave warriors, and they were commanders in his army.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:22
verses.text: Day after day men came to help David, until he had a great army, like the army of God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:23
verses.text: These are the numbers of the men armed for battle who came to David at Hebron to turn Saul's kingdom over to him, as the LORD had said:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:24
verses.text: men of Judah, carrying shield and spear-6,800 armed for battle;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:25
verses.text: men of Simeon, warriors ready for battle-7,100;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:26
verses.text: men of Levi-4,600,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:27
verses.text: including Jehoiada, leader of the family of Aaron, with 3,700 men,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:28
verses.text: and Zadok, a brave young warrior, with 22 officers from his family;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:29
verses.text: men of Benjamin, Saul's kinsmen-3,000, most of whom had remained loyal to Saul's house until then;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:30
verses.text: men of Ephraim, brave warriors, famous in their own clans-20,800;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:31
verses.text: men of half the tribe of Manasseh, designated by name to come and make David king-18,000;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:32
verses.text: men of Issachar, who understood the times and knew what Israel should do-200 chiefs, with all their relatives under their command;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:33
verses.text: men of Zebulun, experienced soldiers prepared for battle with every type of weapon, to help David with undivided loyalty-50,000;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:34
verses.text: men of Naphtali-1,000 officers, together with 37,000 men carrying shields and spears;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:35
verses.text: men of Dan, ready for battle-28,600;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:36
verses.text: men of Asher, experienced soldiers prepared for battle-40,000;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:37
verses.text: and from east of the Jordan, men of Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh, armed with every type of weapon-120,000.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:38
verses.text: All these were fighting men who volunteered to serve in the ranks. They came to Hebron fully determined to make David king over all Israel. All the rest of the Israelites were also of one mind to make David king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:39
verses.text: The men spent three days there with David, eating and drinking, for their families had supplied provisions for them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 12:40
verses.text: Also, their neighbors from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun and Naphtali came bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules and oxen. There were plentiful supplies of flour, fig cakes, raisin cakes, wine, oil, cattle and sheep, for there was joy in Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:1
verses.text: David conferred with each of his officers, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:2
verses.text: He then said to the whole assembly of Israel, "If it seems good to you and if it is the will of the LORD our God, let us send word far and wide to the rest of our brothers throughout the territories of Israel, and also to the priests and Levites who are with them in their towns and pasturelands, to come and join us.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:3
verses.text: Let us bring the ark of our God back to us, for we did not inquire of it during the reign of Saul."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:4
verses.text: The whole assembly agreed to do this, because it seemed right to all the people.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:5
verses.text: So David assembled all the Israelites, from the Shihor River in Egypt to Lebo Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath Jearim.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:6
verses.text: David and all the Israelites with him went to Baalah of Judah (Kiriath Jearim) to bring up from there the ark of God the LORD, who is enthroned between the cherubim-the ark that is called by the Name.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:7
verses.text: They moved the ark of God from Abinadab's house on a new cart, with Uzzah and Ahio guiding it.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:8
verses.text: David and all the Israelites were celebrating with all their might before God, with songs and with harps, lyres, tambourines, cymbals and trumpets.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:9
verses.text: When they came to the threshing floor of Kidon, Uzzah reached out his hand to steady the ark, because the oxen stumbled.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:10
verses.text: The LORD's anger burned against Uzzah, and he struck him down because he had put his hand on the ark. So he died there before God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:11
verses.text: Then David was angry because the LORD's wrath had broken out against Uzzah, and to this day that place is called Perez Uzzah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:12
verses.text: David was afraid of God that day and asked, "How can I ever bring the ark of God to me?"

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:13
verses.text: He did not take the ark to be with him in the City of David. Instead, he took it aside to the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 13:14
verses.text: The ark of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house for three months, and the LORD blessed his household and everything he had.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:1
verses.text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, along with cedar logs, stonemasons and carpenters to build a palace for him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:2
verses.text: And David knew that the LORD had established him as king over Israel and that his kingdom had been highly exalted for the sake of his people Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:3
verses.text: In Jerusalem David took more wives and became the father of more sons and daughters.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:4
verses.text: These are the names of the children born to him there: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:5
verses.text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:6
verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:7
verses.text: Elishama, Beeliada and Eliphelet.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:8
verses.text: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, they went up in full force to search for him, but David heard about it and went out to meet them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:9
verses.text: Now the Philistines had come and raided the Valley of Rephaim;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:10
verses.text: so David inquired of God: "Shall I go and attack the Philistines? Will you hand them over to me?" The LORD answered him, "Go, I will hand them over to you."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:11
verses.text: So David and his men went up to Baal Perazim, and there he defeated them. He said, "As waters break out, God has broken out against my enemies by my hand." So that place was called Baal Perazim.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:12
verses.text: The Philistines had abandoned their gods there, and David gave orders to burn them in the fire.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:13
verses.text: Once more the Philistines raided the valley;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:14
verses.text: so David inquired of God again, and God answered him, "Do not go straight up, but circle around them and attack them in front of the balsam trees.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:15
verses.text: As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, move out to battle, because that will mean God has gone out in front of you to strike the Philistine army."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:16
verses.text: So David did as God commanded him, and they struck down the Philistine army, all the way from Gibeon to Gezer.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 14:17
verses.text: So David's fame spread throughout every land, and the LORD made all the nations fear him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:1
verses.text: After David had constructed buildings for himself in the City of David, he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:2
verses.text: Then David said, "No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, because the LORD chose them to carry the ark of the LORD and to minister before him forever."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:3
verses.text: David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the LORD to the place he had prepared for it.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:4
verses.text: He called together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:5
verses.text: From the descendants of Kohath, Uriel the leader and 120 relatives;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:6
verses.text: from the descendants of Merari, Asaiah the leader and 220 relatives;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:7
verses.text: from the descendants of Gershon, Joel the leader and 130 relatives;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:8
verses.text: from the descendants of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the leader and 200 relatives;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:9
verses.text: from the descendants of Hebron, Eliel the leader and 80 relatives;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:10
verses.text: from the descendants of Uzziel, Amminadab the leader and 112 relatives.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:11
verses.text: Then David summoned Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel and Amminadab the Levites.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:12
verses.text: He said to them, "You are the heads of the Levitical families; you and your fellow Levites are to consecrate yourselves and bring up the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel, to the place I have prepared for it.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:13
verses.text: It was because you, the Levites, did not bring it up the first time that the LORD our God broke out in anger against us. We did not inquire of him about how to do it in the prescribed way."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:14
verses.text: So the priests and Levites consecrated themselves in order to bring up the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:15
verses.text: And the Levites carried the ark of God with the poles on their shoulders, as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:16
verses.text: David told the leaders of the Levites to appoint their brothers as singers to sing joyful songs, accompanied by musical instruments: lyres, harps and cymbals.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:17
verses.text: So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel; from his brothers, Asaph son of Berekiah; and from their brothers the Merarites, Ethan son of Kushaiah;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:18
verses.text: and with them their brothers next in rank: Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:19
verses.text: The musicians Heman, Asaph and Ethan were to sound the bronze cymbals;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:20
verses.text: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah and Benaiah were to play the lyres according to alamoth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:21
verses.text: and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel and Azaziah were to play the harps, directing according to sheminith.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:22
verses.text: Kenaniah the head Levite was in charge of the singing; that was his responsibility because he was skillful at it.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:23
verses.text: Berekiah and Elkanah were to be doorkeepers for the ark.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:24
verses.text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah and Eliezer the priests were to blow trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-Edom and Jehiah were also to be doorkeepers for the ark.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:25
verses.text: So David and the elders of Israel and the commanders of units of a thousand went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-Edom, with rejoicing.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:26
verses.text: Because God had helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD, seven bulls and seven rams were sacrificed.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:27
