verses.text: Now David was clothed in a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who were carrying the ark, and as were the singers, and Kenaniah, who was in charge of the singing of the choirs. David also wore a linen ephod.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:28
verses.text: So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouts, with the sounding of rams' horns and trumpets, and of cymbals, and the playing of lyres and harps.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 15:29
verses.text: As the ark of the covenant of the LORD was entering the City of David, Michal daughter of Saul watched from a window. And when she saw King David dancing and celebrating, she despised him in her heart.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:1
verses.text: They brought the ark of God and set it inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and they presented burnt offerings and fellowship offerings before God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:2
verses.text: After David had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:3
verses.text: Then he gave a loaf of bread, a cake of dates and a cake of raisins to each Israelite man and woman.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:4
verses.text: He appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, to make petition, to give thanks, and to praise the LORD, the God of Israel:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:5
verses.text: Asaph was the chief, Zechariah second, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom and Jeiel. They were to play the lyres and harps, Asaph was to sound the cymbals,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:6
verses.text: and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests were to blow the trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:7
verses.text: That day David first committed to Asaph and his associates this psalm of thanks to the LORD:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:8
verses.text: Give thanks to the LORD, call on his name; make known among the nations what he has done.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:9
verses.text: Sing to him, sing praise to him; tell of all his wonderful acts.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:10
verses.text: Glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:11
verses.text: Look to the LORD and his strength; seek his face always.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:12
verses.text: Remember the wonders he has done, his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:13
verses.text: O descendants of Israel his servant, O sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:14
verses.text: He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:15
verses.text: He remembers his covenant forever, the word he commanded, for a thousand generations,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:16
verses.text: the covenant he made with Abraham, the oath he swore to Isaac.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:17
verses.text: He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:18
verses.text: "To you I will give the land of Canaan as the portion you will inherit."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:19
verses.text: When they were but few in number, few indeed, and strangers in it,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:20
verses.text: they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:21
verses.text: He allowed no man to oppress them; for their sake he rebuked kings:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:22
verses.text: "Do not touch my anointed ones; do my prophets no harm."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:23
verses.text: Sing to the LORD, all the earth; proclaim his salvation day after day.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:24
verses.text: Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:25
verses.text: For great is the LORD and most worthy of praise; he is to be feared above all gods.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:26
verses.text: For all the gods of the nations are idols, but the LORD made the heavens.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:27
verses.text: Splendor and majesty are before him; strength and joy in his dwelling place.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:28
verses.text: Ascribe to the LORD, O families of nations, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:29
verses.text: ascribe to the LORD the glory due his name. Bring an offering and come before him; worship the LORD in the splendor of his holiness.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:30
verses.text: Tremble before him, all the earth! The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:31
verses.text: Let the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad; let them say among the nations, "The LORD reigns!"

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:32
verses.text: Let the sea resound, and all that is in it; let the fields be jubilant, and everything in them!

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:33
verses.text: Then the trees of the forest will sing, they will sing for joy before the LORD, for he comes to judge the earth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:34
verses.text: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his love endures forever.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:35
verses.text: Cry out, "Save us, O God our Savior; gather us and deliver us from the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy name, that we may glory in your praise."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:36
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Then all the people said "Amen" and "Praise the LORD."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:37
verses.text: David left Asaph and his associates before the ark of the covenant of the LORD to minister there regularly, according to each day's requirements.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:38
verses.text: He also left Obed-Edom and his sixty-eight associates to minister with them. Obed-Edom son of Jeduthun, and also Hosah, were gatekeepers.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:39
verses.text: David left Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the tabernacle of the LORD at the high place in Gibeon

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:40
verses.text: to present burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, in accordance with everything written in the Law of the LORD, which he had given Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:41
verses.text: With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the rest of those chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the LORD, "for his love endures forever."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:42
verses.text: Heman and Jeduthun were responsible for the sounding of the trumpets and cymbals and for the playing of the other instruments for sacred song. The sons of Jeduthun were stationed at the gate.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 16:43
verses.text: Then all the people left, each for his own home, and David returned home to bless his family.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:1
verses.text: After David was settled in his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, "Here I am, living in a palace of cedar, while the ark of the covenant of the LORD is under a tent."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:2
verses.text: Nathan replied to David, "Whatever you have in mind, do it, for God is with you."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:3
verses.text: That night the word of God came to Nathan, saying:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:4
verses.text: "Go and tell my servant David, 'This is what the LORD says: You are not the one to build me a house to dwell in.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:5
verses.text: I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought Israel up out of Egypt to this day. I have moved from one tent site to another, from one dwelling place to another.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:6
verses.text: Wherever I have moved with all the Israelites, did I ever say to any of their leaders whom I commanded to shepherd my people, "Why have you not built me a house of cedar?"'

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:7
verses.text: "Now then, tell my servant David, 'This is what the LORD Almighty says: I took you from the pasture and from following the flock, to be ruler over my people Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:8
verses.text: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make your name like the names of the greatest men of the earth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:9
verses.text: And I will provide a place for my people Israel and will plant them so that they can have a home of their own and no longer be disturbed. Wicked people will not oppress them anymore, as they did at the beginning

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:10
verses.text: and have done ever since the time I appointed leaders over my people Israel. I will also subdue all your enemies. "'I declare to you that the LORD will build a house for you:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:11
verses.text: When your days are over and you go to be with your fathers, I will raise up your offspring to succeed you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:12
verses.text: He is the one who will build a house for me, and I will establish his throne forever.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:13
verses.text: I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will never take my love away from him, as I took it away from your predecessor.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:14
verses.text: I will set him over my house and my kingdom forever; his throne will be established forever.'"

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:15
verses.text: Nathan reported to David all the words of this entire revelation.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:16
verses.text: Then King David went in and sat before the LORD, and he said: "Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my family, that you have brought me this far?

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:17
verses.text: And as if this were not enough in your sight, O God, you have spoken about the future of the house of your servant. You have looked on me as though I were the most exalted of men, O LORD God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:18
verses.text: "What more can David say to you for honoring your servant? For you know your servant,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:19
verses.text: O LORD. For the sake of your servant and according to your will, you have done this great thing and made known all these great promises.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:20
verses.text: "There is no one like you, O LORD, and there is no God but you, as we have heard with our own ears.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:21
verses.text: And who is like your people Israel-the one nation on earth whose God went out to redeem a people for himself, and to make a name for yourself, and to perform great and awesome wonders by driving out nations from before your people, whom you redeemed from Egypt?

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:22
verses.text: You made your people Israel your very own forever, and you, O LORD, have become their God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:23
verses.text: "And now, LORD, let the promise you have made concerning your servant and his house be established forever. Do as you promised,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:24
verses.text: so that it will be established and that your name will be great forever. Then men will say, 'The LORD Almighty, the God over Israel, is Israel's God!' And the house of your servant David will be established before you.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:25
verses.text: "You, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build a house for him. So your servant has found courage to pray to you.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:26
verses.text: O LORD, you are God! You have promised these good things to your servant.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 17:27
verses.text: Now you have been pleased to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue forever in your sight; for you, O LORD, have blessed it, and it will be blessed forever."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:1
verses.text: In the course of time, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and he took Gath and its surrounding villages from the control of the Philistines.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:2
verses.text: David also defeated the Moabites, and they became subject to him and brought tribute.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:3
verses.text: Moreover, David fought Hadadezer king of Zobah, as far as Hamath, when he went to establish his control along the Euphrates River.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:4
verses.text: David captured a thousand of his chariots, seven thousand charioteers and twenty thousand foot soldiers. He hamstrung all but a hundred of the chariot horses.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:5
verses.text: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand of them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:6
verses.text: He put garrisons in the Aramean kingdom of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to him and brought tribute. The LORD gave David victory everywhere he went.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:7
verses.text: David took the gold shields carried by the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:8
verses.text: From Tebah and Cun, towns that belonged to Hadadezer, David took a great quantity of bronze, which Solomon used to make the bronze Sea, the pillars and various bronze articles.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:9
verses.text: When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:10
verses.text: he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and congratulate him on his victory in battle over Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou. Hadoram brought all kinds of articles of gold and silver and bronze.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:11
verses.text: King David dedicated these articles to the LORD, as he had done with the silver and gold he had taken from all these nations: Edom and Moab, the Ammonites and the Philistines, and Amalek.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:12
verses.text: Abishai son of Zeruiah struck down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:13
verses.text: He put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became subject to David. The LORD gave David victory everywhere he went.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:14
verses.text: David reigned over all Israel, doing what was just and right for all his people.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:15
verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:16
verses.text: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was secretary;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 18:17
verses.text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and Pelethites; and David's sons were chief officials at the king's side.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:1
verses.text: In the course of time, Nahash king of the Ammonites died, and his son succeeded him as king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:2
verses.text: David thought, "I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me." So David sent a delegation to express his sympathy to Hanun concerning his father. When David's men came to Hanun in the land of the Ammonites to express sympathy to him,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:3
verses.text: the Ammonite nobles said to Hanun, "Do you think David is honoring your father by sending men to you to express sympathy? Haven't his men come to you to explore and spy out the country and overthrow it?"

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:4
verses.text: So Hanun seized David's men, shaved them, cut off their garments in the middle at the buttocks, and sent them away.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:5
verses.text: When someone came and told David about the men, he sent messengers to meet them, for they were greatly humiliated. The king said, "Stay at Jericho till your beards have grown, and then come back."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:6
verses.text: When the Ammonites realized that they had become a stench in David's nostrils, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and charioteers from Aram Naharaim, Aram Maacah and Zobah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:7
verses.text: They hired thirty-two thousand chariots and charioteers, as well as the king of Maacah with his troops, who came and camped near Medeba, while the Ammonites were mustered from their towns and moved out for battle.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:8
verses.text: On hearing this, David sent Joab out with the entire army of fighting men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:9
verses.text: The Ammonites came out and drew up in battle formation at the entrance to their city, while the kings who had come were by themselves in the open country.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:10
verses.text: Joab saw that there were battle lines in front of him and behind him; so he selected some of the best troops in Israel and deployed them against the Arameans.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:11
verses.text: He put the rest of the men under the command of Abishai his brother, and they were deployed against the Ammonites.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:12
verses.text: Joab said, "If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you are to rescue me; but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will rescue you.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:13
verses.text: Be strong and let us fight bravely for our people and the cities of our God. The LORD will do what is good in his sight."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:14
verses.text: Then Joab and the troops with him advanced to fight the Arameans, and they fled before him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:15
verses.text: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans were fleeing, they too fled before his brother Abishai and went inside the city. So Joab went back to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:16
verses.text: After the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they sent messengers and had Arameans brought from beyond the River, with Shophach the commander of Hadadezer's army leading them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:17
verses.text: When David was told of this, he gathered all Israel and crossed the Jordan; he advanced against them and formed his battle lines opposite them. David formed his lines to meet the Arameans in battle, and they fought against him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:18
verses.text: But they fled before Israel, and David killed seven thousand of their charioteers and forty thousand of their foot soldiers. He also killed Shophach the commander of their army.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 19:19
verses.text: When the vassals of Hadadezer saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became subject to him. So the Arameans were not willing to help the Ammonites anymore.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 20:1
verses.text: In the spring, at the time when kings go off to war, Joab led out the armed forces. He laid waste the land of the Ammonites and went to Rabbah and besieged it, but David remained in Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and left it in ruins.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 20:2
verses.text: David took the crown from the head of their king -its weight was found to be a talent of gold, and it was set with precious stones-and it was placed on David's head. He took a great quantity of plunder from the city

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 20:3
verses.text: and brought out the people who were there, consigning them to labor with saws and with iron picks and axes. David did this to all the Ammonite towns. Then David and his entire army returned to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 20:4
verses.text: In the course of time, war broke out with the Philistines, at Gezer. At that time Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, one of the descendants of the Rephaites, and the Philistines were subjugated.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 20:5
verses.text: In another battle with the Philistines, Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, who had a spear with a shaft like a weaver's rod.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 20:6
verses.text: In still another battle, which took place at Gath, there was a huge man with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot-twenty-four in all. He also was descended from Rapha.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 20:7
verses.text: When he taunted Israel, Jonathan son of Shimea, David's brother, killed him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 20:8
verses.text: These were descendants of Rapha in Gath, and they fell at the hands of David and his men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:1
verses.text: Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:2
verses.text: So David said to Joab and the commanders of the troops, "Go and count the Israelites from Beersheba to Dan. Then report back to me so that I may know how many there are."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:3
verses.text: But Joab replied, "May the LORD multiply his troops a hundred times over. My lord the king, are they not all my lord's subjects? Why does my lord want to do this? Why should he bring guilt on Israel?"

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:4
verses.text: The king's word, however, overruled Joab; so Joab left and went throughout Israel and then came back to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:5
verses.text: Joab reported the number of the fighting men to David: In all Israel there were one million one hundred thousand men who could handle a sword, including four hundred and seventy thousand in Judah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:6
verses.text: But Joab did not include Levi and Benjamin in the numbering, because the king's command was repulsive to him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:7
verses.text: This command was also evil in the sight of God; so he punished Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:8
verses.text: Then David said to God, "I have sinned greatly by doing this. Now, I beg you, take away the guilt of your servant. I have done a very foolish thing."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:9
verses.text: The LORD said to Gad, David's seer,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:10
verses.text: "Go and tell David, 'This is what the LORD says: I am giving you three options. Choose one of them for me to carry out against you.'"

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:11
verses.text: So Gad went to David and said to him, "This is what the LORD says: 'Take your choice:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:12
verses.text: three years of famine, three months of being swept away before your enemies, with their swords overtaking you, or three days of the sword of the LORD -days of plague in the land, with the angel of the LORD ravaging every part of Israel.' Now then, decide how I should answer the one who sent me."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:13
verses.text: David said to Gad, "I am in deep distress. Let me fall into the hands of the LORD, for his mercy is very great; but do not let me fall into the hands of men."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:14
verses.text: So the LORD sent a plague on Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell dead.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:15
verses.text: And God sent an angel to destroy Jerusalem. But as the angel was doing so, the LORD saw it and was grieved because of the calamity and said to the angel who was destroying the people, "Enough! Withdraw your hand." The angel of the LORD was then standing at the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:16
verses.text: David looked up and saw the angel of the LORD standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand extended over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell facedown.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:17
verses.text: David said to God, "Was it not I who ordered the fighting men to be counted? I am the one who has sinned and done wrong. These are but sheep. What have they done? O LORD my God, let your hand fall upon me and my family, but do not let this plague remain on your people."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:18
verses.text: Then the angel of the LORD ordered Gad to tell David to go up and build an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:19
verses.text: So David went up in obedience to the word that Gad had spoken in the name of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:20
verses.text: While Araunah was threshing wheat, he turned and saw the angel; his four sons who were with him hid themselves.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:21
verses.text: Then David approached, and when Araunah looked and saw him, he left the threshing floor and bowed down before David with his face to the ground.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:22
verses.text: David said to him, "Let me have the site of your threshing floor so I can build an altar to the LORD, that the plague on the people may be stopped. Sell it to me at the full price."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:23
verses.text: Araunah said to David, "Take it! Let my lord the king do whatever pleases him. Look, I will give the oxen for the burnt offerings, the threshing sledges for the wood, and the wheat for the grain offering. I will give all this."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:24
verses.text: But King David replied to Araunah, "No, I insist on paying the full price. I will not take for the LORD what is yours, or sacrifice a burnt offering that costs me nothing."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:25
verses.text: So David paid Araunah six hundred shekels of gold for the site.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:26
verses.text: David built an altar to the LORD there and sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings. He called on the LORD, and the LORD answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:27
verses.text: Then the LORD spoke to the angel, and he put his sword back into its sheath.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:28
verses.text: At that time, when David saw that the LORD had answered him on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite, he offered sacrifices there.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:29
verses.text: The tabernacle of the LORD, which Moses had made in the desert, and the altar of burnt offering were at that time on the high place at Gibeon.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 21:30
verses.text: But David could not go before it to inquire of God, because he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:1
verses.text: Then David said, "The house of the LORD God is to be here, and also the altar of burnt offering for Israel."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:2
verses.text: So David gave orders to assemble the aliens living in Israel, and from among them he appointed stonecutters to prepare dressed stone for building the house of God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:3
verses.text: He provided a large amount of iron to make nails for the doors of the gateways and for the fittings, and more bronze than could be weighed.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:4
verses.text: He also provided more cedar logs than could be counted, for the Sidonians and Tyrians had brought large numbers of them to David.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:5
verses.text: David said, "My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the LORD should be of great magnificence and fame and splendor in the sight of all the nations. Therefore I will make preparations for it." So David made extensive preparations before his death.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:6
verses.text: Then he called for his son Solomon and charged him to build a house for the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:7
verses.text: David said to Solomon: "My son, I had it in my heart to build a house for the Name of the LORD my God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:8
verses.text: But this word of the LORD came to me: 'You have shed much blood and have fought many wars. You are not to build a house for my Name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in my sight.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:9
verses.text: But you will have a son who will be a man of peace and rest, and I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side. His name will be Solomon, and I will grant Israel peace and quiet during his reign.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:10
verses.text: He is the one who will build a house for my Name. He will be my son, and I will be his father. And I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.'

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:11
verses.text: "Now, my son, the LORD be with you, and may you have success and build the house of the LORD your God, as he said you would.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:12
verses.text: May the LORD give you discretion and understanding when he puts you in command over Israel, so that you may keep the law of the LORD your God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:13
verses.text: Then you will have success if you are careful to observe the decrees and laws that the LORD gave Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or discouraged.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:14
verses.text: "I have taken great pains to provide for the temple of the LORD a hundred thousand talents of gold, a million talents of silver, quantities of bronze and iron too great to be weighed, and wood and stone. And you may add to them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:15
verses.text: You have many workmen: stonecutters, masons and carpenters, as well as men skilled in every kind of work

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:16
verses.text: in gold and silver, bronze and iron-craftsmen beyond number. Now begin the work, and the LORD be with you."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:17
verses.text: Then David ordered all the leaders of Israel to help his son Solomon.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:18
verses.text: He said to them, "Is not the LORD your God with you? And has he not granted you rest on every side? For he has handed the inhabitants of the land over to me, and the land is subject to the LORD and to his people.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 22:19
verses.text: Now devote your heart and soul to seeking the LORD your God. Begin to build the sanctuary of the LORD God, so that you may bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD and the sacred articles belonging to God into the temple that will be built for the Name of the LORD."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:1
verses.text: When David was old and full of years, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:2
verses.text: He also gathered together all the leaders of Israel, as well as the priests and Levites.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:3
verses.text: The Levites thirty years old or more were counted, and the total number of men was thirty-eight thousand.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:4
verses.text: David said, "Of these, twenty-four thousand are to supervise the work of the temple of the LORD and six thousand are to be officials and judges.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:5
verses.text: Four thousand are to be gatekeepers and four thousand are to praise the LORD with the musical instruments I have provided for that purpose."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:6
verses.text: David divided the Levites into groups corresponding to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:7
verses.text: Belonging to the Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:8
verses.text: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the first, Zetham and Joel-three in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:9
verses.text: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel and Haran-three in all. These were the heads of the families of Ladan.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:10
verses.text: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Ziza, Jeush and Beriah. These were the sons of Shimei-four in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:11
verses.text: Jahath was the first and Ziza the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons; so they were counted as one family with one assignment.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:12
verses.text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel-four in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:13
verses.text: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron was set apart, he and his descendants forever, to consecrate the most holy things, to offer sacrifices before the LORD, to minister before him and to pronounce blessings in his name forever.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:14
verses.text: The sons of Moses the man of God were counted as part of the tribe of Levi.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:15
verses.text: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:16
verses.text: The descendants of Gershom: Shubael was the first.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:17
verses.text: The descendants of Eliezer: Rehabiah was the first. Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:18
verses.text: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith was the first.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:19
verses.text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third and Jekameam the fourth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:20
verses.text: The sons of Uzziel: Micah the first and Isshiah the second.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:21
verses.text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:22
verses.text: Eleazar died without having sons: he had only daughters. Their cousins, the sons of Kish, married them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:23
verses.text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth-three in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:24
verses.text: These were the descendants of Levi by their families-the heads of families as they were registered under their names and counted individually, that is, the workers twenty years old or more who served in the temple of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:25
verses.text: For David had said, "Since the LORD, the God of Israel, has granted rest to his people and has come to dwell in Jerusalem forever,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:26
verses.text: the Levites no longer need to carry the tabernacle or any of the articles used in its service."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:27
verses.text: According to the last instructions of David, the Levites were counted from those twenty years old or more.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:28
verses.text: The duty of the Levites was to help Aaron's descendants in the service of the temple of the LORD: to be in charge of the courtyards, the side rooms, the purification of all sacred things and the performance of other duties at the house of God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:29
verses.text: They were in charge of the bread set out on the table, the flour for the grain offerings, the unleavened wafers, the baking and the mixing, and all measurements of quantity and size.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:30
verses.text: They were also to stand every morning to thank and praise the LORD. They were to do the same in the evening

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:31
verses.text: and whenever burnt offerings were presented to the LORD on Sabbaths and at New Moon festivals and at appointed feasts. They were to serve before the LORD regularly in the proper number and in the way prescribed for them.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 23:32
verses.text: And so the Levites carried out their responsibilities for the Tent of Meeting, for the Holy Place and, under their brothers the descendants of Aaron, for the service of the temple of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:1
verses.text: These were the divisions of the sons of Aaron: The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:2
verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they had no sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as the priests.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:3
verses.text: With the help of Zadok a descendant of Eleazar and Ahimelech a descendant of Ithamar, David separated them into divisions for their appointed order of ministering.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:4
verses.text: A larger number of leaders were found among Eleazar's descendants than among Ithamar's, and they were divided accordingly: sixteen heads of families from Eleazar's descendants and eight heads of families from Ithamar's descendants.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:5
verses.text: They divided them impartially by drawing lots, for there were officials of the sanctuary and officials of God among the descendants of both Eleazar and Ithamar.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:6
verses.text: The scribe Shemaiah son of Nethanel, a Levite, recorded their names in the presence of the king and of the officials: Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar and the heads of families of the priests and of the Levites-one family being taken from Eleazar and then one from Ithamar.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:7
verses.text: The first lot fell to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:8
verses.text: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:9
verses.text: the fifth to Malkijah, the sixth to Mijamin,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:10
verses.text: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:11
verses.text: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:12
verses.text: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:13
verses.text: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:14
verses.text: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:15
verses.text: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:16
verses.text: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:17
verses.text: the twenty-first to Jakin, the twenty-second to Gamul,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:18
verses.text: the twenty-third to Delaiah and the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:19
verses.text: This was their appointed order of ministering when they entered the temple of the LORD, according to the regulations prescribed for them by their forefather Aaron, as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:20
verses.text: As for the rest of the descendants of Levi: from the sons of Amram: Shubael; from the sons of Shubael: Jehdeiah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:21
verses.text: As for Rehabiah, from his sons: Isshiah was the first.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:22
verses.text: From the Izharites: Shelomoth; from the sons of Shelomoth: Jahath.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:23
verses.text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third and Jekameam the fourth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:24
verses.text: The son of Uzziel: Micah; from the sons of Micah: Shamir.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:25
verses.text: The brother of Micah: Isshiah; from the sons of Isshiah: Zechariah.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:26
verses.text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The son of Jaaziah: Beno.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:27
verses.text: The sons of Merari: from Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur and Ibri.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:28
verses.text: From Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:29
verses.text: From Kish: the son of Kish: Jerahmeel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:30
verses.text: And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth. These were the Levites, according to their families.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 24:31
verses.text: They also cast lots, just as their brothers the descendants of Aaron did, in the presence of King David and of Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of families of the priests and of the Levites. The families of the oldest brother were treated the same as those of the youngest.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:1
verses.text: David, together with the commanders of the army, set apart some of the sons of Asaph, Heman and Jeduthun for the ministry of prophesying, accompanied by harps, lyres and cymbals. Here is the list of the men who performed this service:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:2
verses.text: From the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah and Asarelah. The sons of Asaph were under the supervision of Asaph, who prophesied under the king's supervision.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:3
verses.text: As for Jeduthun, from his sons: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah and Mattithiah, six in all, under the supervision of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied, using the harp in thanking and praising the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:4
verses.text: As for Heman, from his sons: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shubael and Jerimoth; Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti and Romamti-Ezer; Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir and Mahazioth.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:5
verses.text: All these were sons of Heman the king's seer. They were given him through the promises of God to exalt him. God gave Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:6
verses.text: All these men were under the supervision of their fathers for the music of the temple of the LORD, with cymbals, lyres and harps, for the ministry at the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun and Heman were under the supervision of the king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:7
verses.text: Along with their relatives-all of them trained and skilled in music for the LORD -they numbered 288.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:8
verses.text: Young and old alike, teacher as well as student, cast lots for their duties.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:9
verses.text: The first lot, which was for Asaph, fell to Joseph, his sons and relatives, 12 the second to Gedaliah, he and his relatives and sons, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:10
verses.text: the third to Zaccur, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:11
verses.text: the fourth to Izri, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:12
verses.text: the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:13
verses.text: the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:14
verses.text: the seventh to Jesarelah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:15
verses.text: the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:16
verses.text: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:17
verses.text: the tenth to Shimei, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:18
verses.text: the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:19
verses.text: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:20
verses.text: the thirteenth to Shubael, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:21
verses.text: the fourteenth to Mattithiah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:22
verses.text: the fifteenth to Jerimoth, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:23
verses.text: the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:24
verses.text: the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:25
verses.text: the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:26
verses.text: the nineteenth to Mallothi, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:27
verses.text: the twentieth to Eliathah, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:28
verses.text: the twenty-first to Hothir, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:29
verses.text: the twenty-second to Giddalti, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:30
verses.text: the twenty-third to Mahazioth, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 25:31
verses.text: the twenty-fourth to Romamti-Ezer, his sons and relatives, 12

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:1
verses.text: The divisions of the gatekeepers: From the Korahites: Meshelemiah son of Kore, one of the sons of Asaph.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:2
verses.text: Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:3
verses.text: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth and Eliehoenai the seventh.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:4
verses.text: Obed-Edom also had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:5
verses.text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh and Peullethai the eighth. (For God had blessed Obed-Edom.)

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:6
verses.text: His son Shemaiah also had sons, who were leaders in their father's family because they were very capable men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:7
verses.text: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed and Elzabad; his relatives Elihu and Semakiah were also able men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:8
verses.text: All these were descendants of Obed-Edom; they and their sons and their relatives were capable men with the strength to do the work-descendants of Obed-Edom, 62 in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:9
verses.text: Meshelemiah had sons and relatives, who were able men-18 in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:10
verses.text: Hosah the Merarite had sons: Shimri the first (although he was not the firstborn, his father had appointed him the first),

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:11
verses.text: Hilkiah the second, Tabaliah the third and Zechariah the fourth. The sons and relatives of Hosah were 13 in all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:12
verses.text: These divisions of the gatekeepers, through their chief men, had duties for ministering in the temple of the LORD, just as their relatives had.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:13
verses.text: Lots were cast for each gate, according to their families, young and old alike.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:14
verses.text: The lot for the East Gate fell to Shelemiah. Then lots were cast for his son Zechariah, a wise counselor, and the lot for the North Gate fell to him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:15
verses.text: The lot for the South Gate fell to Obed-Edom, and the lot for the storehouse fell to his sons.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:16
verses.text: The lots for the West Gate and the Shalleketh Gate on the upper road fell to Shuppim and Hosah. Guard was alongside of guard:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:17
verses.text: There were six Levites a day on the east, four a day on the north, four a day on the south and two at a time at the storehouse.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:18
verses.text: As for the court to the west, there were four at the road and two at the court itself.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:19
verses.text: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers who were descendants of Korah and Merari.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:20
verses.text: Their fellow Levites were in charge of the treasuries of the house of God and the treasuries for the dedicated things.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:21
verses.text: The descendants of Ladan, who were Gershonites through Ladan and who were heads of families belonging to Ladan the Gershonite, were Jehieli,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:22
verses.text: the sons of Jehieli, Zetham and his brother Joel. They were in charge of the treasuries of the temple of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:23
verses.text: From the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites and the Uzzielites:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:24
verses.text: Shubael, a descendant of Gershom son of Moses, was the officer in charge of the treasuries.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:25
verses.text: His relatives through Eliezer: Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zicri his son and Shelomith his son.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:26
verses.text: Shelomith and his relatives were in charge of all the treasuries for the things dedicated by King David, by the heads of families who were the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and by the other army commanders.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:27
verses.text: Some of the plunder taken in battle they dedicated for the repair of the temple of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:28
verses.text: And everything dedicated by Samuel the seer and by Saul son of Kish, Abner son of Ner and Joab son of Zeruiah, and all the other dedicated things were in the care of Shelomith and his relatives.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:29
verses.text: From the Izharites: Kenaniah and his sons were assigned duties away from the temple, as officials and judges over Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:30
verses.text: From the Hebronites: Hashabiah and his relatives-seventeen hundred able men-were responsible in Israel west of the Jordan for all the work of the LORD and for the king's service.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:31
verses.text: As for the Hebronites, Jeriah was their chief according to the genealogical records of their families. In the fortieth year of David's reign a search was made in the records, and capable men among the Hebronites were found at Jazer in Gilead.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 26:32
verses.text: Jeriah had twenty-seven hundred relatives, who were able men and heads of families, and King David put them in charge of the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh for every matter pertaining to God and for the affairs of the king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:1
verses.text: This is the list of the Israelites-heads of families, commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and their officers, who served the king in all that concerned the army divisions that were on duty month by month throughout the year. Each division consisted of 24,000 men.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:2
verses.text: In charge of the first division, for the first month, was Jashobeam son of Zabdiel. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:3
verses.text: He was a descendant of Perez and chief of all the army officers for the first month.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:4
verses.text: In charge of the division for the second month was Dodai the Ahohite; Mikloth was the leader of his division. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:5
verses.text: The third army commander, for the third month, was Benaiah son of Jehoiada the priest. He was chief and there were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:6
verses.text: This was the Benaiah who was a mighty man among the Thirty and was over the Thirty. His son Ammizabad was in charge of his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:7
verses.text: The fourth, for the fourth month, was Asahel the brother of Joab; his son Zebadiah was his successor. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:8
verses.text: The fifth, for the fifth month, was the commander Shamhuth the Izrahite. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:9
verses.text: The sixth, for the sixth month, was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:10
verses.text: The seventh, for the seventh month, was Helez the Pelonite, an Ephraimite. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:11
verses.text: The eighth, for the eighth month, was Sibbecai the Hushathite, a Zerahite. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:12
verses.text: The ninth, for the ninth month, was Abiezer the Anathothite, a Benjamite. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:13
verses.text: The tenth, for the tenth month, was Maharai the Netophathite, a Zerahite. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:14
verses.text: The eleventh, for the eleventh month, was Benaiah the Pirathonite, an Ephraimite. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:15
verses.text: The twelfth, for the twelfth month, was Heldai the Netophathite, from the family of Othniel. There were 24,000 men in his division.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:16
verses.text: The officers over the tribes of Israel: over the Reubenites: Eliezer son of Zicri; over the Simeonites: Shephatiah son of Maacah;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:17
verses.text: over Levi: Hashabiah son of Kemuel; over Aaron: Zadok;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:18
verses.text: over Judah: Elihu, a brother of David; over Issachar: Omri son of Michael;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:19
verses.text: over Zebulun: Ishmaiah son of Obadiah; over Naphtali: Jerimoth son of Azriel;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:20
verses.text: over the Ephraimites: Hoshea son of Azaziah; over half the tribe of Manasseh: Joel son of Pedaiah;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:21
verses.text: over the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead: Iddo son of Zechariah; over Benjamin: Jaasiel son of Abner;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:22
verses.text: over Dan: Azarel son of Jeroham. These were the officers over the tribes of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:23
verses.text: David did not take the number of the men twenty years old or less, because the LORD had promised to make Israel as numerous as the stars in the sky.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:24
verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah began to count the men but did not finish. Wrath came on Israel on account of this numbering, and the number was not entered in the book of the annals of King David.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:25
verses.text: Azmaveth son of Adiel was in charge of the royal storehouses. Jonathan son of Uzziah was in charge of the storehouses in the outlying districts, in the towns, the villages and the watchtowers.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:26
verses.text: Ezri son of Kelub was in charge of the field workers who farmed the land.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:27
verses.text: Shimei the Ramathite was in charge of the vineyards. Zabdi the Shiphmite was in charge of the produce of the vineyards for the wine vats.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:28
verses.text: Baal-Hanan the Gederite was in charge of the olive and sycamore-fig trees in the western foothills. Joash was in charge of the supplies of olive oil.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:29
verses.text: Shitrai the Sharonite was in charge of the herds grazing in Sharon. Shaphat son of Adlai was in charge of the herds in the valleys.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:30
verses.text: Obil the Ishmaelite was in charge of the camels. Jehdeiah the Meronothite was in charge of the donkeys.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:31
verses.text: Jaziz the Hagrite was in charge of the flocks. All these were the officials in charge of King David's property.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:32
verses.text: Jonathan, David's uncle, was a counselor, a man of insight and a scribe. Jehiel son of Hacmoni took care of the king's sons.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:33
verses.text: Ahithophel was the king's counselor. Hushai the Arkite was the king's friend.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 27:34
verses.text: Ahithophel was succeeded by Jehoiada son of Benaiah and by Abiathar. Joab was the commander of the royal army.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:1
verses.text: David summoned all the officials of Israel to assemble at Jerusalem: the officers over the tribes, the commanders of the divisions in the service of the king, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and the officials in charge of all the property and livestock belonging to the king and his sons, together with the palace officials, the mighty men and all the brave warriors.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:2
verses.text: King David rose to his feet and said: "Listen to me, my brothers and my people. I had it in my heart to build a house as a place of rest for the ark of the covenant of the LORD, for the footstool of our God, and I made plans to build it.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:3
verses.text: But God said to me, 'You are not to build a house for my Name, because you are a warrior and have shed blood.'

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:4
verses.text: "Yet the LORD, the God of Israel, chose me from my whole family to be king over Israel forever. He chose Judah as leader, and from the house of Judah he chose my family, and from my father's sons he was pleased to make me king over all Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:5
verses.text: Of all my sons-and the LORD has given me many-he has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:6
verses.text: He said to me: 'Solomon your son is the one who will build my house and my courts, for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:7
verses.text: I will establish his kingdom forever if he is unswerving in carrying out my commands and laws, as is being done at this time.'

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:8
verses.text: "So now I charge you in the sight of all Israel and of the assembly of the LORD, and in the hearing of our God: Be careful to follow all the commands of the LORD your God, that you may possess this good land and pass it on as an inheritance to your descendants forever.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:9
verses.text: "And you, my son Solomon, acknowledge the God of your father, and serve him with wholehearted devotion and with a willing mind, for the LORD searches every heart and understands every motive behind the thoughts. If you seek him, he will be found by you; but if you forsake him, he will reject you forever.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:10
verses.text: Consider now, for the LORD has chosen you to build a temple as a sanctuary. Be strong and do the work."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:11
verses.text: Then David gave his son Solomon the plans for the portico of the temple, its buildings, its storerooms, its upper parts, its inner rooms and the place of atonement.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:12
verses.text: He gave him the plans of all that the Spirit had put in his mind for the courts of the temple of the LORD and all the surrounding rooms, for the treasuries of the temple of God and for the treasuries for the dedicated things.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:13
verses.text: He gave him instructions for the divisions of the priests and Levites, and for all the work of serving in the temple of the LORD, as well as for all the articles to be used in its service.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:14
verses.text: He designated the weight of gold for all the gold articles to be used in various kinds of service, and the weight of silver for all the silver articles to be used in various kinds of service:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:15
verses.text: the weight of gold for the gold lampstands and their lamps, with the weight for each lampstand and its lamps; and the weight of silver for each silver lampstand and its lamps, according to the use of each lampstand;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:16
verses.text: the weight of gold for each table for consecrated bread; the weight of silver for the silver tables;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:17
verses.text: the weight of pure gold for the forks, sprinkling bowls and pitchers; the weight of gold for each gold dish; the weight of silver for each silver dish;

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:18
verses.text: and the weight of the refined gold for the altar of incense. He also gave him the plan for the chariot, that is, the cherubim of gold that spread their wings and shelter the ark of the covenant of the LORD.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:19
verses.text: "All this," David said, "I have in writing from the hand of the LORD upon me, and he gave me understanding in all the details of the plan."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:20
verses.text: David also said to Solomon his son, "Be strong and courageous, and do the work. Do not be afraid or discouraged, for the LORD God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you or forsake you until all the work for the service of the temple of the LORD is finished.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 28:21
verses.text: The divisions of the priests and Levites are ready for all the work on the temple of God, and every willing man skilled in any craft will help you in all the work. The officials and all the people will obey your every command."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:1
verses.text: Then King David said to the whole assembly: "My son Solomon, the one whom God has chosen, is young and inexperienced. The task is great, because this palatial structure is not for man but for the LORD God.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:2
verses.text: With all my resources I have provided for the temple of my God-gold for the gold work, silver for the silver, bronze for the bronze, iron for the iron and wood for the wood, as well as onyx for the settings, turquoise, stones of various colors, and all kinds of fine stone and marble-all of these in large quantities.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:3
verses.text: Besides, in my devotion to the temple of my God I now give my personal treasures of gold and silver for the temple of my God, over and above everything I have provided for this holy temple:

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:4
verses.text: three thousand talents of gold (gold of Ophir) and seven thousand talents of refined silver, for the overlaying of the walls of the buildings,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:5
verses.text: for the gold work and the silver work, and for all the work to be done by the craftsmen. Now, who is willing to consecrate himself today to the LORD?"

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:6
verses.text: Then the leaders of families, the officers of the tribes of Israel, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and the officials in charge of the king's work gave willingly.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:7
verses.text: They gave toward the work on the temple of God five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze and a hundred thousand talents of iron.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:8
verses.text: Any who had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the temple of the LORD in the custody of Jehiel the Gershonite.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:9
verses.text: The people rejoiced at the willing response of their leaders, for they had given freely and wholeheartedly to the LORD. David the king also rejoiced greatly.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:10
verses.text: David praised the LORD in the presence of the whole assembly, saying, "Praise be to you, O LORD, God of our father Israel, from everlasting to everlasting.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:11
verses.text: Yours, O LORD, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the majesty and the splendor, for everything in heaven and earth is yours. Yours, O LORD, is the kingdom; you are exalted as head over all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:12
verses.text: Wealth and honor come from you; you are the ruler of all things. In your hands are strength and power to exalt and give strength to all.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:13
verses.text: Now, our God, we give you thanks, and praise your glorious name.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:14
verses.text: "But who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to give as generously as this? Everything comes from you, and we have given you only what comes from your hand.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:15
verses.text: We are aliens and strangers in your sight, as were all our forefathers. Our days on earth are like a shadow, without hope.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:16
verses.text: O LORD our God, as for all this abundance that we have provided for building you a temple for your Holy Name, it comes from your hand, and all of it belongs to you.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:17
verses.text: I know, my God, that you test the heart and are pleased with integrity. All these things have I given willingly and with honest intent. And now I have seen with joy how willingly your people who are here have given to you.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:18
verses.text: O LORD, God of our fathers Abraham, Isaac and Israel, keep this desire in the hearts of your people forever, and keep their hearts loyal to you.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:19
verses.text: And give my son Solomon the wholehearted devotion to keep your commands, requirements and decrees and to do everything to build the palatial structure for which I have provided."

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:20
verses.text: Then David said to the whole assembly, "Praise the LORD your God." So they all praised the LORD, the God of their fathers; they bowed low and fell prostrate before the LORD and the king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:21
verses.text: The next day they made sacrifices to the LORD and presented burnt offerings to him: a thousand bulls, a thousand rams and a thousand male lambs, together with their drink offerings, and other sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:22
verses.text: They ate and drank with great joy in the presence of the LORD that day. Then they acknowledged Solomon son of David as king a second time, anointing him before the LORD to be ruler and Zadok to be priest.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:23
verses.text: So Solomon sat on the throne of the LORD as king in place of his father David. He prospered and all Israel obeyed him.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:24
verses.text: All the officers and mighty men, as well as all of King David's sons, pledged their submission to King Solomon.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:25
verses.text: The LORD highly exalted Solomon in the sight of all Israel and bestowed on him royal splendor such as no king over Israel ever had before.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:26
verses.text: David son of Jesse was king over all Israel.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:27
verses.text: He ruled over Israel forty years-seven in Hebron and thirty-three in Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:28
verses.text: He died at a good old age, having enjoyed long life, wealth and honor. His son Solomon succeeded him as king.

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:29
verses.text: As for the events of King David's reign, from beginning to end, they are written in the records of Samuel the seer, the records of Nathan the prophet and the records of Gad the seer,

verses.name: 1 Chronicles 29:30
verses.text: together with the details of his reign and power, and the circumstances that surrounded him and Israel and the kingdoms of all the other lands.
